meanings.definition: Having an acidic taste or smell
meanings.sent1: The lemon was the sourest fruit in the basket.
meanings.sent2: The vinegar was the sourest thing she had ever tasted.
meanings.sent3: He made a face as if he had just bitten into the sourest lemon in the world.
meanings.sent4: The sourest grapes seemed to pucker his lips with each bite.
meanings.sent5: Her expression turned sour after sipping the sourest drink at the party.

meanings.definition: Showing a bad temper or mood
meanings.sent1: His sourest expression greeted us when we arrived late.
meanings.sent2: She had the sourest attitude whenever things didn't go her way.
meanings.sent3: Even the sourest of faces couldn't resist smiling at the silly joke.
meanings.sent4: The sourest mood lifted when he received good news.
meanings.sent5: The sourest person in the office surprisingly cracked a joke today.
